citations.narrative:
The licensee is currently housing his animals covered by the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) at a location that has not been
disclosed or inspected and approved by the USDA, Animal Care. Licenses are issued to specific persons, and are issued
for specific activities, types and numbers of animals, and approved sites.
Failure to provide such notifications prevents Animal Care’s inspection to assess animal care and welfare and AWA
compliance.
A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days before any change in the name, address, management,
substantial control or ownership of his business or operation, locations, activities, and number or type of animals
described in 2.1(b)(2). Any person who is subject to the AWA and who intends to exhibit any animal at any location other
than the person’s approved site must submit written itineraries in accordance with § 2.126. The licensee must provide
these notifications as required by this regulation for any future occurrences.
Correct by end of business 01 March 2024

Inspector attempted to contact licensee by knocking on the door and calling the cell phone number.
The licensee failed to have a responsible person available to conduct an animal welfare inspection. The facility was not
able to be inspected for compliance with the Animal Welfare Act, regulations and standards to ensure the health and well-
being of the animals.
A responsible person must be available to accompany the inspector on an animal welfare inspection.
End Section
